alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 140 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Encinoso, or 22 miles northeast of Ruidoso. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, nickel size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitan and Encinoso. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 81 and 82, between Mile Markers 87 and 89, and between Mile Markers 92 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
